TopicTitle: How to disable collision detection on a part with .cfg editing?

Articles.Content: I want to disable collision-detection on a part, because one of my crafts with clipped parts has a 50% chance to explode on the launchpad. Is that possible with a simple .cfg edit?
From what I saw in editing .cfg files, you cannot. I think collision is done in the model. You have to do several things to the model before you can import it to a game.
But you can use welding plugin to make this craft one single-welded part (see UbioZur's plug-in).
AFAIK you can turn off collision within one part, when importing it from Unity, but to disable specific collisions, you have to write a .dll
